intro: Euphrasia × zirnichiana, commonly known as the hybrid eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euphrasia × zirnichiana is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and disturbed soils, thriving in partial shade to full sun.
